summary.en: X is the letter â€œX,â€ often used for an unknown (x), a cross-shaped mark, or the action â€œto cross out.â€

definition.en: the 24th letter of the English alphabet; used to represent an unknown thing or variable

examples.en: Solve for x in the equation.
Weâ€™ll call the unknown person X for now.

definition.en: a symbol shaped like two crossing lines; used to mean a cross, a mark, or a wrong answer

examples.en: Put an X next to the correct choice.
The teacher marked the wrong answers with an X.

definition.en: to cross out something (usually writing) with an X to show it is removed or not correct

examples.en: Please X out the extra words.
I Xâ€™d out my old address and wrote the new one.

summary.en: X is the letter â€œX,â€ often used as a symbol for an unknown value, a mark (like a cross), or the multiplication sign; it can also relate to â€œX-ratedâ€ content.

definition.en: the 24th letter of the English alphabet

examples.en: Her name starts with X.
Write an X in the box.

definition.en: a symbol used for an unknown value in math, science, or general problems

examples.en: Solve for x: x + 3 = 10.
If x is greater than 5, the result changes.

definition.en: the multiplication sign (Ã—)

examples.en: 3 Ã— 4 equals 12.
On some keyboards, people type x instead of Ã—.

definition.en: a mark meaning â€œwrong,â€ â€œnot chosen,â€ â€œcancelled,â€ or â€œcrossed outâ€

examples.en: Put an X next to the correct answer.
The old date was marked with an X.

definition.en: to cross out; to cancel by drawing an X over something

examples.en: Please X out the mistakes.
They Xed out the cancelled order.

definition.en: used to describe adult content (X-rated)

examples.en: That movie is X-rated, so minors canâ€™t watch it.

summary.en: X-rated describes adult-only media or content because it is sexually explicit; it can also mean very sexually explicit in general conversation.

definition.en: (Of movies, videos, magazines, etc.) officially classified as suitable only for adults because it contains explicit sex.

examples.en: That film was X-rated, so no one under 18 was allowed in.
The store keeps X-rated magazines behind the counter.

definition.en: (More generally, in conversation) containing very explicit sexual content; pornographic.

examples.en: He made an X-rated joke that wasnâ€™t appropriate for work.
They warned the lyrics were a bit X-rated.

extraExplanation: æ³¨æ„è¯­å¢ƒç¤¼è²Œï¼šåœ¨æ­£å¼åœºåˆå¯ä»¥ç”¨æ›´å§”å©‰çš„è¯´æ³•ï¼Œå¦‚ â€œadult contentâ€ æˆ– â€œsexually explicit contentâ€ã€‚

summary.en: An X-ray is a kind of radiation used to see inside things, especially for medical imaging; it can also mean the image itself or the act of scanning.

definition.en: A type of high-energy electromagnetic radiation used to see inside objects (especially the human body) and to take medical images.

examples.en: The doctor ordered an X-ray of her chest.
The X-ray showed a small fracture in his wrist.

definition.en: A medical image produced using X-rays (often called an â€œX-ray imageâ€ or â€œX-ray filmâ€).

examples.en: Can you send the X-ray to the specialist?
She kept a copy of the X-ray for her records.

definition.en: To examine or scan using X-rays.

examples.en: They X-rayed his ankle to check for a break.
All baggage is X-rayed at the airport.

summary.en: Xanthine is a naturally occurring chemical in the body and some foods, related to caffeine, and involved in purine breakdown to uric acid.

definition.en: a natural chemical found in the body and in some foods; it is related to caffeine and can be changed into uric acid

examples.en: Xanthine is a compound involved in how the body breaks down purines.
Caffeine and theophylline are xanthine-related substances found in drinks like coffee and tea.
Doctors may measure xanthine levels when studying certain rare metabolic disorders.

summary.en: Xanthoastrocytoma is a rare (often slow-growing) brain tumor arising from astrocytes, commonly in younger people.

definition.en: a rare type of brain tumor (usually slow-growing) that develops from astrocytes (star-shaped support cells in the brain); often found in children or young adults.

examples.en: The MRI suggested a xanthoastrocytoma in the temporal lobe.
After surgery, the doctors monitored the xanthoastrocytoma for recurrence.

summary.en: A rare benign inflammatory lesion, often a yellowish skin bump (common in children), or more broadly a type of yellow, granuloma-forming chronic inflammation in organs.

definition.en: A rare, usually non-cancerous (benign) inflammatory growth made of immune cells (histiocytes), often forming a yellowish skin bump; most commonly seen in children as juvenile xanthogranuloma.

examples.en: The dermatologist suspected a xanthogranuloma because the bump was small, firm, and yellow-orange.
Most juvenile xanthogranulomas go away on their own without treatment.

definition.en: More broadly, a â€œxanthogranulomaâ€ can refer to xanthogranulomatous inflammationâ€”long-lasting inflammation that forms yellow, fatty-looking tissue in an organ (for example, in the kidney).

examples.en: Imaging suggested xanthogranulomatous inflammation, which can sometimes mimic an infection or tumor.
The report mentioned xanthogranuloma-like changes in the tissue sample.

summary.en: A medical adjective describing a yellow, lipid-rich granulomatous type of inflammation.

definition.en: (Medical) Having or relating to inflammation that forms granulomas (small nodules of immune cells) containing yellow, lipid-rich (â€œxantho-â€) cells.

examples.en: The pathology report described xanthogranulomatous inflammation of the kidney.
Xanthogranulomatous cholecystitis can mimic gallbladder cancer on imaging.

summary.en: A xanthoma is a yellowish fatty skin deposit often associated with high cholesterol or lipid disorders.

definition.en: A yellowish, fatty deposit under the skin, often appearing as small bumps or plaques, especially around the eyelids, elbows, knees, or tendons; it is often linked to high blood cholesterol or other lipid disorders.

examples.en: The doctor noted a xanthoma on her eyelid and ordered a cholesterol test.
Some xanthomas can be a sign of an underlying lipid disorder.

summary.en: â€œXBâ€ is an abbreviation most often meaning â€œex-boyfriend,â€ but it can also refer to â€œXboxâ€ or simply the letters X and B depending on context.

definition.en: an abbreviation used in texting/informal writing for â€œex-boyfriend.â€

examples.en: My XB texted me last night, but I didnâ€™t reply.
Sheâ€™s trying to stay friends with her XB.

definition.en: an abbreviation for â€œXbox,â€ Microsoftâ€™s video game console (often written as Xbox rather than XB).

examples.en: He plays on his Xbox after work.
Do you have Xbox Game Pass?
examples.zh: ä½ æœ‰ Xbox çš„ Game Pass è®¢é˜…å—ï¼Ÿ

definition.en: a general abbreviation meaning â€œX, Bâ€ (two labels/variables), used in technical notes, diagrams, or filenames; meaning depends on context.

examples.en: Compare group X and group B in the chart.
Save the file as project_XB_final.docx.

summary.en: Xbox is Microsoftâ€™s video game console and gaming service brand.

definition.en: A brand of video game consoles and gaming services made by Microsoft.

examples.en: I play games on my Xbox after school.
Xbox Game Pass lets you try many games for a monthly fee.

summary.en: â€œXDâ€ is an internet emoticon meaning â€œlaughing hard / thatâ€™s funny.â€

definition.en: an internet expression showing laughter or that something is very funny; it visually looks like a laughing face (X = closed eyes, D = big open mouth)

examples.en: That meme is so good, XD
You actually did it? XD
Stop, I canâ€™t breatheâ€”XD

definition.en: (less common today) used to show playful teasing, light embarrassment, or a silly mood in casual chat

examples.en: I forgot my keys again XD
I was just kidding, XD

summary.en: â€œXeâ€ most commonly means the chemical symbol for xenon; it can also be used as a gender-neutral pronoun (â€œxeâ€).

definition.en: the chemical symbol for xenon, a colorless, odorless noble gas (element 54).

examples.en: The balloon was filled with Xe, so it wouldnâ€™t react with other chemicals.
Some car headlights use xenon (Xe) to produce a bright light.

definition.en: a gender-neutral pronoun used by some people; often used like â€œthey,â€ as in â€œXe isâ€¦â€

examples.en: Xe said xe would arrive at 6.
Iâ€™ll ask what pronouns xe uses in email.

summary.en: Xenical is a brand-name weight-loss medicine (orlistat) that reduces fat absorption.

definition.en: A brand-name prescription medicine (orlistat) used to help people with obesity lose weight by reducing how much fat the body absorbs from food.

examples.en: My doctor prescribed Xenical along with a low-fat diet and exercise plan.
Xenical works best when meals are not too high in fat.
Some people stop Xenical because of stomach-related side effects.

summary.en: A xenobiotic is a foreign chemical in a living organism, such as a drug or pollutant; it can also describe things related to such foreign substances.

definition.en: a chemical substance that is foreign to a living organism (not naturally produced by the body), such as a drug, pesticide, or industrial pollutant

examples.en: Many medicines are xenobiotics because the body does not naturally produce them.
The liver helps break down xenobiotics so they can be removed from the body.
Environmental scientists study how xenobiotics move through soil and water.

definition.en: foreign to an organism; relating to a substance that comes from outside the body or ecosystem

examples.en: This study focuses on xenobiotic compounds found in river water.
Some enzymes are specialized for xenobiotic metabolism.

summary.en: Xenocentric describes someone who thinks foreign cultures or products are better than their own.

definition.en: Believing that other countries, cultures, or ways of life are better than your own; showing an excessive preference for what is foreign.

examples.en: Heâ€™s very xenocentric and insists that everything from abroad is higher quality.
A xenocentric attitude can make people undervalue their own traditions.

summary.en: A â€œforeignâ€ crystal carried into an igneous rock from a different source.

definition.en: A crystal that formed in a different rock or magma and was later carried into another igneous rock (a â€œforeignâ€ crystal).

examples.en: The thin section shows a xenocryst of olivine surrounded by fine-grained basalt.
Geologists use xenocrysts to infer the history of magma mixing and movement.

extraExplanation: è¯æºï¼šxeno- è¡¨ç¤ºâ€œå¤–æ¥çš„ã€å¼‚åŸŸçš„â€ï¼ˆå¦‚ xenophobiaï¼‰ï¼Œcryst æ¥è‡ª crystalï¼ˆæ™¶ä½“ï¼‰ã€‚å› æ­¤ xenocryst å­—é¢æ„æ€å°±æ˜¯â€œå¤–æ¥çš„æ™¶ä½“â€ã€‚

summary.en: Xenogeneic means coming from a different species, especially in medical contexts like transplants.

definition.en: From a different species; involving tissues, cells, or organs taken from one species and used in another (especially in medicine).

examples.en: Researchers are testing xenogeneic heart valves made from pig tissue.
Xenogeneic transplants can trigger strong immune rejection.

extraExplanation: è¯æºï¼šxeno- è¡¨ç¤ºâ€œé™Œç”Ÿçš„/å¤–æ¥çš„â€ï¼ˆå¦‚ xenophobiaâ€œæ’å¤–/æå¤–â€ï¼‰ï¼Œ-genic æ¥è‡ª gene/genre ç›¸å…³è¯æ ¹ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºâ€œäº§ç”Ÿ/æ¥æºâ€ã€‚åˆèµ·æ¥å¤§æ„æ˜¯â€œæ¥è‡ªå¤–ç§ï¼ˆå¤–æ¥çš„æ¥æºï¼‰â€ã€‚

summary.en: Xenogenesis means the production of radically different offspring, and itâ€™s also used in sciâ€‘fi to describe alien or foreign-origin new life.

definition.en: the origin or production of offspring that are very different from their parents; in biology, the idea of producing a new, distinct form (often used historically and not accepted as modern science).

examples.en: In older writings, xenogenesis was used to explain why a young animal seemed unlike its parents.
Today, scientists treat xenogenesis as a historical idea rather than a valid biological process.

definition.en: in literature (especially science fiction), a theme in which something foreign or alien gives rise to new life or a transformed species.

examples.en: The novel uses xenogenesis to explore what it means to be human after contact with an alien species.
In sciâ€‘fi discussions, readers often call this kind of hybrid rebirth xenogenesis.

extraExplanation: è¯æºï¼šxeno- è¡¨ç¤ºâ€œé™Œç”Ÿçš„ã€å¤–æ¥çš„â€ï¼ˆå¦‚ xenophobia æ’å¤–/æå¤–ï¼‰ï¼Œ-genesis è¡¨ç¤ºâ€œèµ·æºã€ç”Ÿæˆâ€ï¼ˆå¦‚ genesis èµ·æºã€oxygenï¼ˆè¯æ ¹ gen ä¸â€œäº§ç”Ÿâ€ç›¸å…³ï¼‰ï¼‰ã€‚

summary.en: A xenograft is a transplant from one species to another.

definition.en: A transplant of tissue or an organ from one species to a different species (for example, from a pig to a human).

examples.en: Doctors are studying pig-to-human xenografts to address organ shortages.
Because the donor is a different species, a xenograft may trigger a strong immune reaction.

summary.en: Xenon is a rare noble gas element (Xe) used in some lighting and other technologies.

definition.en: a chemical element (symbol Xe) that is a colorless, odorless noble gas, found in very small amounts in Earthâ€™s atmosphere

examples.en: Xenon is a noble gas, so it rarely reacts with other elements.
Some high-intensity lamps use xenon to produce a bright white light.

summary.en: Xenon: a colorless, odorless noble gas element (Xe) used especially in lighting and some technical/medical fields.

definition.en: a chemical element (symbol Xe) that is a colorless, odorless noble gas; it is very unreactive and is used in lights and some medical/technical applications

examples.en: Xenon is a noble gas, so it rarely forms compounds.
Some car headlights use xenon to produce a bright, white light.
In hospitals, xenon can be used in certain imaging and anesthesia research.

extraExplanation: å­¦ä¹ æç¤ºï¼šå…ƒç´ åç§°åœ¨è‹±è¯­é‡Œé€šå¸¸ä¸åŠ å† è¯æ—¶æŒ‡â€œè¿™ç§ç‰©è´¨æ•´ä½“â€ï¼ˆXenon isâ€¦ï¼‰ï¼ŒåŠ å† è¯æˆ–é‡è¯æ—¶æŒ‡â€œæŸä¸€ä»½/æŸäº›æ°™æ°”â€ï¼ˆa sample of xenonï¼‰ã€‚

summary.en: A xenophile is someone who is fond of foreign people or cultures.

definition.en: A person who likes, admires, or is very interested in people, cultures, or things from other countries.

examples.en: As a xenophile, she loves trying foods from around the world.
Heâ€™s a xenophile who enjoys learning languages and meeting visitors from abroad.

summary.en: A xenophobe is someone who fears or strongly dislikes foreigners or foreign cultures.

definition.en: a person who strongly dislikes or fears people from other countries or cultures

examples.en: Some people wrongly label immigrants as dangerous; that kind of thinking can come from a xenophobe.
The film shows how a xenophobeâ€™s beliefs can harm an entire community.

extraExplanation: è¯æºï¼šxeno- è¡¨ç¤ºâ€œå¤–å›½çš„ã€é™Œç”Ÿçš„â€ï¼ˆå¦‚ xenophobiaâ€œæ’å¤–/ä»‡å¤–â€ï¼‰ï¼Œ-phobe è¡¨ç¤ºâ€œå®³æ€•â€¦â€¦çš„äººâ€ã€‚å› æ­¤ xenophobe æŒ‡â€œå®³æ€•æˆ–åŒæ¶å¤–å›½äºº/å¤–æ¥æ–‡åŒ–çš„äººâ€ã€‚
ç”¨æ³•æç¤ºï¼šxenophobe å¸¸å¸¦å¼ºçƒˆè´Ÿé¢è¯„ä»·ï¼ŒæŒ‡å¸¦åè§æˆ–æ­§è§†å€¾å‘çš„äººï¼›æ›´ä¸­æ€§çš„è¯´æ³•å¯ç”¨ â€œsomeone who is hostile to outsiders / anti-immigrantâ€ç­‰ï¼Œå…·ä½“è¯­å¢ƒè¦è°¨æ…ã€‚

summary.en: Xenophobia means fear or hostility toward foreigners or foreign cultures.

definition.en: fear, dislike, or distrust of people from other countries or cultures

examples.en: The campaign tried to reduce xenophobia by sharing immigrantsâ€™ stories.
Xenophobia can lead to unfair laws and discrimination.
She spoke out against xenophobia after the incident on the subway.

summary.en: Xenophobic describes attitudes or behavior that fear, dislike, or oppose foreigners or foreign cultures.

definition.en: Having or showing a strong fear or dislike of people from other countries or cultures.

examples.en: The candidate was criticized for making xenophobic comments about immigrants.
Some online posts spread xenophobic stereotypes during the crisis.

summary.en: â€œXerocopyâ€ means a photocopy or the act of making a photocopy, originally connected to the Xerox brand.

definition.en: a copy of a document made with a photocopier (often, a Xerox machine).

examples.en: Could you make a xerocopy of this ID for the file?
I left the original at home, but I brought a xerocopy.

definition.en: to make a photocopy of a document.

examples.en: Please xerocopy these pages and staple them together.
Iâ€™ll xerocopy the notes so everyone has a copy.

summary.en: Xeroderma means unusually dry skin; it can also appear in specific disease names in medical contexts.

definition.en: A medical condition in which the skin is abnormally dry, rough, or scaly because it lacks enough moisture (often used as a symptom description).

examples.en: In winter, some people develop xeroderma on their hands and legs.
The doctor suggested gentle moisturizer for xeroderma caused by frequent handwashing.

definition.en: (In specific medical terms) A group of disorders involving abnormal skin dryness, sometimes used in disease names (e.g., xeroderma pigmentosum).

examples.en: Xeroderma pigmentosum is a rare genetic condition that makes skin extremely sensitive to UV light.

summary.en: Xerography is the dry, electrostatic toner-based process used in most photocopiers.

definition.en: a printing/copying process that uses dry powder (toner) and electrostatic charges to create images on paper; the technology behind most photocopiers and many laser printers

examples.en: Most office photocopiers work by xerography, using toner instead of liquid ink.
Xerography made it much faster and cheaper to duplicate documents.

summary.en: A xerophyte is a plant adapted to survive in very dry environments.

definition.en: a plant that is adapted to live in very dry places (such as deserts) by saving water or reducing water loss

examples.en: Cacti are classic xerophytes that store water in thick stems.
Many xerophytes have small, waxy leaves to reduce water loss.
In dry regions, farmers may choose crops with xerophyte-like traits.

summary.en: Xerophytic describes plants adapted to very dry environments; it can also refer to such a plant (xerophyte).

definition.en: (Of a plant) adapted to living in very dry conditions by saving water (for example, with thick leaves, waxy surfaces, or deep roots).

examples.en: Cacti are classic xerophytic plants that store water in their stems.
The xerophytic shrubs in this desert garden need very little watering.

definition.en: A xerophytic plant; a plant that can live in very dry environments.

examples.en: Only a few xerophytes can survive on this rocky hillside.
Many xerophytes have small leaves to reduce water loss.

extraExplanation: å­¦ä¹ æç¤ºï¼šæ—¥å¸¸è‹±è¯­ä¸­æ›´å¸¸è§çš„è¯æ˜¯ drought-tolerantï¼ˆè€æ—±çš„ï¼‰æˆ– desert-adaptedï¼ˆé€‚åº”æ²™æ¼ çš„ï¼‰ã€‚å­¦æœ¯å†™ä½œã€ç”Ÿæ€å­¦/æ¤ç‰©å­¦æ–‡ç« ä¸­æ›´å¸¸è§ xerophytic / xerophyteã€‚

summary.en: Xerosis is the medical term for unusually dry skin.

definition.en: abnormally dry skin, often causing roughness, flaking, itching, or cracking.

examples.en: In winter, many people develop xerosis on their hands from cold air and frequent washing.
The doctor recommended a thick moisturizer to relieve xerosis and itching.

summary.en: Xerostomia is the medical term for an unusually dry mouth caused by reduced saliva.

definition.en: a medical condition in which your mouth feels unusually dry because you are not making enough saliva

examples.en: After radiation therapy, he developed xerostomia and had trouble swallowing.
Many people with xerostomia find it hard to speak for long without drinking water.
If you think you have xerostomia, tell your dentist or doctor.

summary.en: â€œXeroxâ€ is a brand name often used to mean a photocopier or a photocopy, and itâ€™s also used as a verb meaning â€œto photocopy.â€

definition.en: a brand name for a photocopier; also used to mean a photocopy or a photocopier in general

examples.en: I left the contract on the Xerox in the office.
Could you make a Xerox of this page for me?

definition.en: to photocopy something

examples.en: Please Xerox these handouts before class.
I xeroxed my ID and attached it to the form.

summary.en: â€œXeroxâ€ is commonly used (informally) to mean a photocopy or to photocopy something, though it began as a brand name.

definition.en: a photocopy; a copy made with a photocopier (often used informally)

examples.en: Please bring a xerox of your passport.
I made two xeroxes of the contract for the meeting.

definition.en: to photocopy something

examples.en: Could you xerox these notes for the class?
I need to xerox this form before I submit it.

summary.en: â€œXeroxedâ€ means â€œphotocopiedâ€ and can describe a copy or the action of making a photocopy.

definition.en: copied using a photocopier; photocopied.

examples.en: I xeroxed the contract and gave everyone a copy.
Do you have a xeroxed ID I can keep for our records?

definition.en: to photocopy (a document).

examples.en: Could you xerox these notes before class?
She xeroxed the receipts for tax purposes.

summary.en: â€œXeroxesâ€ means photocopies, or it can mean â€œmakes photocopiesâ€ (as a verb).

definition.en: photocopies; copies made with a photocopier (often from the brand name â€œXeroxâ€).

examples.en: I made two xeroxes of the form for you.
Please keep the original and file the xeroxes in this folder.

definition.en: makes photocopies; photocopies (third-person singular of â€œxeroxâ€).

examples.en: She xeroxes all the receipts at the end of each week.
The office assistant xeroxes the handouts before the meeting.

summary.en: Xeroxing means photocopying; it can also mean the act of making photocopies.

definition.en: making a photocopy of a document (often using a Xerox machine, or any photocopier)

examples.en: Iâ€™m xeroxing the handouts for tomorrowâ€™s class.
Could you help me with xeroxing these forms?

definition.en: the act or process of photocopying

examples.en: Xeroxing large packets can take a while.
Thereâ€™s a small fee for xeroxing in the library.

summary.en: â€œxihcoâ€ is not a recognized English word; it likely needs context or a corrected spelling.

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It may be a typo, a username, an acronym, or a word from another language.

examples.en: I canâ€™t find â€œxihcoâ€ in an English dictionaryâ€”did you mean a different spelling?
If â€œxihcoâ€ is a name or abbreviation, please tell me what it refers to.

summary.en: â€œXinCheJianâ€ is not an English word; itâ€™s likely pinyin for a Chinese name/phrase (often â€œæ–°è½¦é—´â€ = â€œnew workshop/production shopâ€), but the exact meaning needs the Chinese characters.

definition.en: A romanized (pinyin-style) spelling of a Chinese phrase/name; it is not a standard English word. Most commonly it corresponds to Chinese characters like â€œæ–°è½¦é—´,â€ meaning â€œnew workshop/production shop,â€ but the exact meaning depends on the original Chinese characters.

examples.en: The sign says â€œXinCheJian,â€ which is likely the pinyin for a Chinese name (e.g., a workshop).
Please send the Chinese characters for â€œXinCheJianâ€ so I can translate it accurately.

summary.en: Xinjiang: a region in northwestern China (Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region).

definition.en: A region in far northwestern China, officially the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, bordering several Central and South Asian countries.

examples.en: Xinjiang is known for its deserts, mountains, and long-distance trade routes.
The city of ÃœrÃ¼mqi is the capital of Xinjiang.
Some news reports discuss agriculture and energy production in Xinjiang.

summary.en: Xiphisternum is an anatomical term for the small pointed part at the bottom of the sternum (the xiphoid process).

definition.en: the small, pointed piece of cartilage/bone at the lower end of the sternum (breastbone); the xiphoid process

examples.en: In anatomy class, we learned that the xiphisternum is the same as the xiphoid process.
First-aid training warns not to press on the xiphisternum during chest compressions.

summary.en: Xiphoid means â€œshaped like a sword,â€ and in medicine it usually refers to the xiphoid process, the small pointed tip at the bottom of the sternum.

definition.en: A small pointed piece of cartilage (that often becomes bone with age) at the lower end of the sternum (breastbone).

examples.en: During CPR training, we learned not to press on the xiphoid process because it can break.
The doctor noted tenderness near the xiphoid area.

summary.en: â€œxisâ€ usually means the plural of the Greek letter â€œxi,â€ used as a symbol in math/science.

definition.en: Plural of â€œxi,â€ the 14th letter of the Greek alphabet, used in math and science (especially to name variables).

examples.en: In the equation, the two xis represent different random variables.
The professor wrote three xis on the board and labeled them xâ‚, xâ‚‚, and xâ‚ƒ.

definition.en: (All caps) An abbreviation used in some fields for specific technical or organizational terms; meaning depends on context.

examples.en: The manual says the device supports XIS, but it doesnâ€™t explain which standard.
In this document, XIS is defined in the glossary.

summary.en: XIV is the Roman numeral for 14, often used in chapter numbers and historical titles (e.g., Louis XIV).

definition.en: the Roman numeral for the number 14

examples.en: Chapter XIV explains the main idea in simple terms.
Turn to page XIV in the front section of the book.

definition.en: used in names and titles to show order, especially for kings, queens, popes, or events (read as the number)

examples.en: Louis XIV is often called the â€œSun King.â€
In the movie title, â€œPart XIVâ€ means â€œPart Fourteen.â€

summary.en: Xoco is most commonly a place name in Mexico City; it can also come from Nahuatl meaning â€œsour/tart,â€ especially in Mexican food/plant names.

definition.en: a neighborhood (colonia) in Mexico City, known for being near CoyoacÃ¡n and for modern developments around the area.

examples.en: We stayed in Xoco to be close to CoyoacÃ¡n and the museums.
The metro station called Xoco makes the area easy to reach.

definition.en: (from Nahuatl) â€œsourâ€ or â€œtartâ€; often seen as a word part in names of foods or plants in Mexico.

examples.en: In some Mexican words, xoco can refer to a sour flavor.
Xoconostle is a cactus fruit whose name is related to this â€˜sourâ€™ root.

summary.en: Xocolatl is a historical Mesoamerican cacao drink and a Nahuatl term often linked to the origin of the word â€œchocolate.â€

definition.en: (historical) A bitter cacao-based drink from Mesoamerica (especially associated with the Aztec/Mexica), often flavored with spices and sometimes served frothy.

examples.en: In many histories, xocolatl is described as a spiced, unsweetened cacao drink.
They served a version of xocolatl at the museum event to show what chocolate may have tasted like centuries ago.

definition.en: The Nahuatl word often cited as an origin of the English word â€œchocolate.â€

examples.en: Some sources connect the word â€œchocolateâ€ to Nahuatl xocolatl.
Linguistics students sometimes encounter xocolatl when studying the history of food words.

summary.en: â€œXuriâ€ is usually used as a name or username in English, not a common vocabulary word with a fixed meaning.

definition.en: A personal name or username (not a standard English dictionary word). The meaning depends on the language or the person who chose it.

examples.en: My gamer tag is Xuri.
Xuri emailed me the file last night.

summary.en: â€œXVâ€ is the Roman numeral for 15, often used as a formal label (Chapter XV, Louis XV).

definition.en: the Roman numeral for 15

examples.en: Chapter XV is one of the most memorable parts of the book.
Louis XV ruled France in the 1700s.

definition.en: used as a label meaning â€œnumber 15â€ (for example, a volume, chapter, item, or edition)

examples.en: Please read Act XV for tomorrowâ€™s class.
This is Volume XV of the encyclopedia.

definition.en: (especially in British English) a rugby union team of 15 players; also used in names like â€œEngland XVâ€

examples.en: An England XV played a warm-up match before the tournament.

summary.en: â€œXXâ€ can mean the Roman numeral 20, a typical female chromosome pair, a sign for â€œkissesâ€ in messages, or a placeholder for hidden/unknown text.

definition.en: the Roman numeral for 20

examples.en: The chapter is labeled XX in the table of contents.
He wrote XX at the top to mark the number twenty.

definition.en: the pair of X chromosomes typically associated with females in humans (contrasted with XY)

examples.en: In basic genetics lessons, XX often refers to a typical female chromosome pattern.
The report lists the karyotype as XX.

definition.en: two letter Xâ€™s used as a written sign meaning â€œkisses,â€ often at the end of a message

examples.en: Text me when you get homeâ€”xx.
She ended the note with â€œLove, xx.â€

definition.en: a symbol used to replace unknown or hidden information (like a placeholder)

examples.en: For privacy, the form shows his phone number as 555-xx-xx.
The address was written as â€œxx Streetâ€ because it was confidential.

summary.en: Xylanase is an enzyme that breaks down plant xylan and is widely used in food, feed, and paper processing.

definition.en: an enzyme that breaks down xylan (a major part of plant cell walls) into smaller sugars, often used in baking, animal feed, and paper-making

examples.en: Xylanase is added to some bread dough to improve texture and volume.
Feed producers use xylanase to help animals digest plant-based ingredients more efficiently.
In the paper industry, xylanase can reduce the need for harsh chemicals during processing.

summary.en: Xylem is the plant tissue that transports water and minerals from roots to the rest of the plant.

definition.en: The plant tissue that carries water and dissolved minerals from the roots up to the stems and leaves.

examples.en: Water moves upward through the xylem to reach the leaves.
If the xylem is damaged, a plant may wilt even when the soil is wet.

summary.en: Xylene is a colorless, flammable industrial solvent (a mix of three isomers) used in products like paint thinner and in labs.

definition.en: A colorless, sweet-smelling liquid chemical used as an industrial solvent and in making products like paints, inks, and plastics; it is a mixture of three related forms (o-, m-, and p-xylene).

examples.en: The lab uses xylene to clean glass slides after staining.
Workers must use ventilation when handling xylene-based paint thinners.

summary.en: Xylitol is a low-calorie sweetener (a sugar alcohol) often used in sugar-free foods and dental products.

definition.en: a sweet-tasting sugar alcohol used as a low-calorie sweetener, common in sugar-free gum, candies, and dental products; it does not raise blood sugar as much as regular sugar

examples.en: This gum is sweetened with xylitol instead of sugar.
Some toothpastes include xylitol to help reduce cavity-causing bacteria.
If you have diabetes, ask your doctor whether xylitol is a good option for you.

summary.en: Xylol is an older name for xylene, a flammable solvent used for thinning paints and cleaning or dissolving materials.

definition.en: A clear, flammable solvent made from mixed xylene isomers (aromatic hydrocarbons), used to thin paint/varnish and to clean or dissolve substances in labs and industry.

examples.en: The technician used xylol to remove sticky residue from the glass slides.
Because xylol is flammable, it must be stored away from heat and open flames.

summary.en: A xylophone is a percussion instrument with wooden bars you strike to make musical notes.

definition.en: A musical instrument with a set of wooden bars that you strike with small sticks (mallets) to produce notes.

examples.en: The child learned a simple melody on the xylophone.
In the orchestra, the percussionist played the xylophone during the fast section.

summary.en: Xylose is a natural plant sugar, especially associated with wood and plant fibers.

definition.en: a natural sugar (a five-carbon â€œsimple sugarâ€) found in plants such as wood and some fruits; used in food and in scientific research

examples.en: Xylose is found in plant fibers such as hemicellulose.
Some labs use xylose to study how cells process different sugars.

summary.en: Xylulose is a rare five-carbon ketose sugar used mainly in biochemistry.

definition.en: a simple sugar (a ketopentose) found in small amounts in nature and used in biochemistry and metabolism studies

examples.en: Xylulose is a five-carbon sugar that appears in certain metabolic pathways.
In the lab, researchers may measure xylulose levels to study how the body processes sugars.

summary.en: â€œXYZâ€ commonly refers to the letters X, Y, and Z, often used as variables or as a generic placeholder name.

definition.en: the letters X, Y, and Z used together, often as variables (unknown values) in math, science, or charts.

examples.en: In algebra, x, y, and z can represent unknown numbers.
The graph shows the relationship between X, Y, and Z.

definition.en: a generic name used as a placeholder when the real name or details are unknown or not important.

examples.en: Letâ€™s call the new project â€˜XYZâ€™ for now.
Company XYZ is a small startup in California.

definition.en: unspecified or unknown; used to describe something whose exact identity isnâ€™t given.

examples.en: Please contact the XYZ department for more information.
